skill.name: adaptyv
skill.description: Cloud laboratory platform for automated protein testing and validation. Use when designing proteins and needing experimental validation including binding assays, expression testing, thermostability measurements, enzyme activity assays, or protein sequence optimization. Also use for submitting experiments via API, tracking experiment status, downloading results, optimizing protein sequences for better expression using computational tools (NetSolP, SoluProt, SolubleMPNN, ESM), or managing protein design workflows with wet-lab validation.
skill.summary: Cloud laboratory platform for automated protein testing and validation. Use when designing proteins ...
skill.author: K-Dense Inc.

security_audit.summary: The skill is documentation with code examples that use an API key from environment variables and send HTTP requests to Adaptyv and NetSolP endpoints. Examples write results to local files. No obfuscation, persistence, or hidden execution paths were found.

content.value_statement: You need wet lab validation for protein designs but lack internal capacity. This skill guides API submissions, status tracking, and result retrieval.
actual_capabilities: Explain API authentication using the ADAPTYV_API_KEY environment variable
Provide Python examples to submit single or batch experiments
Show how to check experiment status and list experiments
Show how to download results and save JSON files locally
Demonstrate target catalog search and custom target requests
limitations: Requires Adaptyv API access and a valid API key
Experiments typically take about 21 days to complete
Platform features are in alpha or beta and may change
Optimization tools require separate installation and compute

use_cases.title: Validate binding variants
use_cases.description: Submit binding assays for variant panels and track affinity results across design rounds.

use_cases.title: Plan expression screens
use_cases.description: Batch submit sequences for expression testing and compare yields for manufacturability.

use_cases.title: Optimize then test
use_cases.description: Filter sequences with solubility tools and submit top candidates for wet lab validation.

prompt_templates.title: First submission
prompt_templates.prompt: Provide a minimal Python example to submit one sequence for expression testing and check status once.

prompt_templates.title: Batch submission
prompt_templates.prompt: Show a batch submission example for 10 sequences with metadata and explain the key response fields.

prompt_templates.title: Results download
prompt_templates.prompt: Explain how to download experiment results and save them to a JSON file with a clear filename.

prompt_templates.title: Optimization pipeline
prompt_templates.prompt: Outline a workflow that filters sequences with solubility tools, selects top candidates, and submits them to Adaptyv.

output_examples.input: Summarize the steps to submit a binding assay and track completion.
output: Prepare FASTA sequences and choose the binding experiment type
Send a POST request to the experiments endpoint with your API key
Store the experiment ID from the response
Check status with the experiment ID or use a webhook
Download results when the status is completed

best_practices: Use webhooks for long running experiments instead of frequent polling
Validate FASTA formatting and include controls before submission
Batch related sequences to reduce overhead and improve comparison
anti_patterns: Embedding API keys in code or sharing them in logs
Polling every minute for multi day experiments
Submitting large libraries without pre screening

faq.question: Is this compatible with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code?
faq.answer: Yes. The guidance is platform neutral and works with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code.

faq.question: What are the main limits?
faq.answer: You need Adaptyv access, credits, and a typical turnaround of about 21 days.

faq.question: Can I integrate this with my pipeline?
faq.answer: Yes. The API supports programmatic submissions, status checks, and result downloads.

faq.question: Is my data safe?
faq.answer: The skill only documents API calls you choose to run and does not add extra data collection.

faq.question: What if a request fails?
faq.answer: Check the error response, validate sequences, and retry with backoff or contact support.

faq.question: How does this compare to running assays locally?
faq.answer: It avoids lab setup but has longer turnaround time and requires external credits.
